abstract: The New York Fed defended itself against complaints it had told A.I.G. to cover up bailout details in public filings, saying it had suggested deleting a sentence on payments to banks only because “it was not in fact precisely accurate.”
snippet: The New York Fed defended itself against complaints it had told A.I.G. to cover up bailout details in public filings, saying it had suggested deleting a sentence on payments to banks only because “it was not in fact precisely accurate.”
lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve Bank of New York defended itself on Tuesday against complaints that it had told the American International Group not to disclose critical bailout details in public filings, saying it had only suggested deleting a sentence about paying the insurer’s trading partners 100 cents on the dollar because “it was not in fact precisely accurate.”

headline.main: New York Fed Defends Move in A.I.G. Bailout

abstract: World markets dropped Wednesday, led by a near 3 percent tumble in Shanghai’s stock benchmark, as investors fretted about new curbs on the lavish bank lending that has driven China’s economic revival.
snippet: World markets dropped Wednesday, led by a near 3 percent tumble in Shanghai’s stock benchmark, as investors fretted about new curbs on the lavish bank lending that has driven China’s economic revival.
lead_paragraph: World markets dropped Wednesday, led by a near 3 percent tumble in Shanghai’s stock benchmark, as investors fretted about new curbs on the lavish bank lending that has driven China’s economic revival.

headline.main: World Stocks Fall Amid Fears of China Bank Curbs

abstract: Morgan Stanley and Goldman Sachs find themselves on different ends of the pay debate, as the surviving Wall Street titans prepare to disclose their fourth-quarter results.
snippet: Morgan Stanley and Goldman Sachs find themselves on different ends of the pay debate, as the surviving Wall Street titans prepare to disclose their fourth-quarter results.
lead_paragraph: Longtime rivals Morgan Stanley and Goldman Sachs  find themselves on different ends of the pay debate, as the surviving Wall Street titans prepare to disclose their fourth-quarter results, Reuters writes.

headline.main: Goldman and Morgan Pay May Overshadow Results

abstract: Bank of America will likely post another loss when it reports fourth-quarter earnings on Wednesday, as banks continue to grapple with their problem loans and a weak economy.
snippet: Bank of America will likely post another loss when it reports fourth-quarter earnings on Wednesday, as banks continue to grapple with their problem loans and a weak economy.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America likely will post another loss when it reports fourth-quarter earnings on Wednesday, as banks continue to grapple with their problems loans and a weak economy, Reuters reported.

headline.main: Analysts Expect 4th Quarter Loss for BofA

abstract: Bank of America reported a $5.2 billion loss for the fourth quarter of 2009, as the firm continued to weather increased mortgage losses and paid back billions of dollars in government bailout money.
snippet: Bank of America reported a $5.2 billion loss for the fourth quarter of 2009, as the firm continued to weather increased mortgage losses and paid back billions of dollars in government bailout money.
lead_paragraph: Update | 7:25 a.m. Strapped consumers continue to rain on Wall Street’s victory parade, but the deluge may be easing.

headline.main: Bank of America Posts Loss for 4th Quarter

abstract: Brian T. Moynihan, the new chief executive of Bank of America, fielded a barrage of questions from analysts on Wednesday, all more curious about his plans going forward than about the bank’s fourth-quarter loss of $5.2 billion.
snippet: Brian T. Moynihan, the new chief executive of Bank of America, fielded a barrage of questions from analysts on Wednesday, all more curious about his plans going forward than about the bank’s fourth-quarter loss of $5.2 billion.
lead_paragraph: Brian T. Moynihan, the new chief executive of Bank of America, fielded a barrage of questions from analysts on Wednesday, all curious about his plans for the bank.

headline.main: Analysts Press New BofA Chief on His Plans
